website_summaries.verdict: Convenient slimline design is portable and can be used in test tubes. Good choice for those investing in a pH tester for the first time.
pros: Between auto calibration, buffer recognition, and other intelligent functions, it’s as user-friendly as you can get
Comes with durable case that fits into your pocket
Probes are replaceable, so you don’t need to buy a new unit every time
cons: Some users would have appreciated a backlit screen, especially when using it in low-light conditions

customer_reviews.title: Product Doesn't Come As Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: In the picture, it implies that the pH meter comes with a case and buffer solutions, but all I got was the pH meter in a plastic bag. The pH meter cannot be used without any buffer solutions to calibrate the device, so now I have to go buy some buffer solutions somewhere else. It would be nice for the seller to change the pictures displayed and make it clear that the case and buffer solutions needed for calibration are not included.
customer_reviews.author: tspinning

customer_reviews.title: Update to original review
customer_reviews.text: Update: I contacted Apera directly and they sent me a new unit. The new unit works perfectly. Significant time saved on ph testing (avg. 10 seconds for stable reading) & calibration (avg. 1 second for calibration), compared to the $20 pen testers I've used in the past. I would definitely recommend this product. Original review: I've gone through 6 sets of batteries with this device in the past month. If batteries are left in device, they are spent within 24 hrs. Now the return window is closed, so I'm stuck with a defective device. Unfortunate because it reads very quickly and is extremely simple to calibrate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pH pen for amateurs
customer_reviews.text: I've been using multiple forms of determining pH (test strips, drops, cheap pens), but all of them were either not accurate enough or required initial setup outside the packaging (cheap pens for example require de-ionized water for their powdered controls, which costs another $4-7 per liter or $25 per gallon). This has everything you need right out of the box, and the KCl was a nice touch, so you won't have to constantly re-calibrate the pen after every test. Definitely recommend this product if your unfamiliar with pH testing and don't need commercial grade (pH testing in the ±0.001 range).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I got this pH meter for my aquaria. It is very easy to use and the tip fits in the 5ml test tubes used for testing the water quality. It seems to be accurate as its readings match what I get with the API colorimetric test. The kit includes everything you need (even spare batteries) except distilled water. The instructions are clear and easy to follow. A second advantage of the smaller tip is that just 5 drops of 3M KCl (also included) in the cap is enough to preserve the sensor bulb. I highly recommend this pH meter.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Standarized Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this pen for a little over 3 months now. I've been using it to maintain a coco/hydroponic garden. The pen works great. I like the speed and reliability, but most of all the standardization for calibration. I've used the cheapo generic pH pens, and while the do work, you can never really trust them (inconsistent readings, powdery make-yourself pH solutions). I don't usually do reviews, but Apera was offering a free gift (a "Calbox") in exchange for an honest review. Hopefully they honor it.

product_meta.title: SX610 Waterproof pH Pen Tester, ±0.1 pH Accuracy, 0-14.0 pH Range, Suitable for Test Tube Testing, Replaceable Probe
product_meta.description: Style:±0.1 pH (1pt calibration)Aprea Instruments SX610 pH Pen Tester is designed for reliable measuring performance with a single-button easy operation in a mini body. A cost-effective choice for your general-purpose pH testing, including hydroponics, aquaculture, water treatment, pools & spas, beverage making, education, etc. The 8mm slim pH probe is replaceable and suitable for test tube measuring. Easy Auto. Calibration (1 point: 7. 0 pH) with buffer recognition and 0 to 60˚C Auto. Temperature Compensation (ATC), 0. 1 pH/1. 0˚C accuracy with 0 to 14. 0 pH measuring range. Intelligent functions: switch from ˚F to ˚C, automatic power-off, low battery alarm, pH probe invalidation reminder (reminds you to replace the probe for reliable performance). The meter comes with a complete kit of premixed calibration solutions (7. 0 pH), storage solution (3M KCL), CR2032 lithium batteries all in a small pocket carrying case. IP57 waterproof and dustproof floats on water, so you don’t have to worry if it falls in water by accident. The product is CE and RoHS certified, and is manufactured under an ISO 9001: 2015 certified quality system. Do NOT store the probe in distilled water or deionized water since it will cause damage to the electrode. Only use distilled water for rinsing the pH probe.
feature_bullets: Easy SINGLE-Button Operation, Smallest Pen-Style design with replaceable probe (good for test tube measurements)
AUTO Calibration with auto buffer recognition; Auto Temperature Compensation (ATC) ensures accuracy in variant temperatures (0-60.0C)
COMPLETE KIT with READY-TO-USE calibration solution, KCl storage solution, and batteries in a portable carrying case
Intelligent functions: temperature unit switch from F to C, automatic power-off, low battery alarm, and pH probe invalidation reminder
AUTO RECOGNITION and REMINDER of stable values improves consistency, saving you the trouble of guessing when to manually hold measurement
